questions.question: What is a net in the context of building 3D shapes?
options: A 2D skeleton-outline that can be folded into a 3D shape
answer: A 2D skeleton-outline that can be folded into a 3D shape

questions.question: Which type of sketch does not have proportional lengths but conveys all important aspects of the appearance of a solid shape?
When observing a 2D shadow of a 3D shape, what information can be obtained?
What is the purpose of slicing a solid shape
options: To create nets for building 3D shapes
To view different sections of the shape
To cast a 2D shadow of the shape
To measure the volume of the shape
answer: To view different sections of the shape

questions.question: Why are isometric sketches considered more challenging to create than oblique sketches?
options: Isometric sketches require advanced mathematical calculations
Isometric sketches involve maintaining proportional measurements
Oblique sketches have more details to consider
answer: Isometric sketches involve maintaining proportional measurements

questions.question:
I have 12-line segments and 8 corners,
My skin is made of 6 square faces, no borders.
What am I, can you tell?
Visualize me well.

My faces are not all the same,
Curved and straight, they play a game.
I have no corners, only one edge,
What am I, take a pledge.

My faces are like triangles in a row.
When you stack me up, I look like a peak,
